intro: Cardamine × killiasii, commonly known as the hybrid buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and delicate yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has a short rhizomatous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
